site.name: Triton Framework
site.description: Official documentation for the Triton Framework — module loading, window chrome, class protection, and the Triton desktop runtime.

docs.title: EchelonFrame
docs.description: Cross-platform base JFrame for all Triton windows. Always undecorated with custom WindowFactory chrome, enrolled with EchelonWindowPlacer, and supports window-open animations (zoom-reveal, fade). Manages a concurrent animation queue so rapid module launches each get their own animation.

docs.title: WindowFactory
docs.description: Factory and utility class for custom Swing window chrome. Builds the macOS-style traffic-light title bar with a purple Move-to-Screen button, installs an 8-pixel edge/corner resizer, manages the animation queue, and provides dialog chrome helpers.

docs.title: CustomTitleBars
docs.description: FlatLaf-based custom title bar installer for JFrames and JDialogs. Installs globally via an AWT event listener and provides FrameTitleBar and DialogTitleBar components with drag, double-click maximize, active/inactive color transitions, and the purple Move-to-Screen button.

docs.title: EchelonChromeBridge
docs.description: Auto-applies Triton chrome to any JFrame opened at runtime, covering legacy modules that don't call WindowFactory directly. Uses a global AWT event listener and never double-decorates. Falls back gracefully if WindowFactory or FlatLaf are unavailable.

docs.title: ChromeContentPane
docs.description: Shielded JPanel content pane that preserves the chrome title bar in NORTH and transparently forwards all user add/remove/setLayout calls to an inner client panel. Hardened against early superclass calls during JFrame construction.

docs.title: CentralModuleOpener
docs.description: Central dispatch point for opening any loadable item in the Triton desktop. Handles on-the-fly Java compilation, JAR launching, native execution, and graceful fallback. Inner classes ModuleData and ModuleFirstClassLoader handle data transport and mod-aware class loading respectively.

docs.title: ModProtection
docs.description: Runtime annotation controlling whether a framework class can be overridden by module mod/ files. Supports ALLOW_MOD (silent override), DISALLOW_MOD (blocked with notification), and an implicit default that permits override but notifies the user.

docs.title: BottomBarMenuProvider
docs.description: Optional interface for modules that want a custom right-click context menu on their bottom bar button. Implement buildBottomBarMenu() to return a JPopupMenu with module-specific items. The shell appends default items (Bring to Front, Hide, Pin, Close) automatically after a separator.
